intro: Weberbauera chillanensis, commonly known as the Chilean weberbaueria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Weberbauera chillanensis is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions.
